meanings.sent1: The young bird was reliant on its mother for food.
meanings.sent2: She felt safe and secure, knowing she was reliant on her loyal dog for protection.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to be reliant on the mouse, but it was just a clever trick.
meanings.sent4: His happiness was reliant on the sunshine, always brightening his mood.
meanings.sent5: The fragile plant was reliant on regular watering to survive.

meanings.definition: Trusting or having confidence in someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He was reliant on his best friend to keep his secrets safe.
meanings.sent2: The team was reliant on each other to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The detective was overly reliant on his lucky charm to solve cases.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was reliant on the kind words of her loved ones to feel joy.
meanings.sent5: The child was reliant on the nightlight to chase away the shadows.
